comment.body: The problem with ZeroNet is the simplicity that the clearnet has.. Not a problem for devs but for common people.. This simplifies many things, thanks for this implementation experiment!! =)
My slow internet (0.65-0.35 Kbps) will love this tar.gz implementation :D

well.. MANY CONGRATULATIONS in primis! Then :)

- Why decentralization important to you?

I love the idea of a free to access Internet extended worldwide, I love the idea of a continue enhancement as fast as technology evolves! (in Italy we are stuck in 90s in some zones.. at home I have a cabled 0.65/0.35 mbps line for example.... and pay much more than a fiber line.) 

Then a decentralization gives the opportunity to reach every corner of the world, even where censorship is very strict! This is an important point!

- What's bad with the current Internet?

People is starting to use Internet day by day, so the load on servers is higher day by day too... In a decentralized world, following the ZN idea.. the most popular zites are the fastest!

- Why are you using ZeroNet?

I believe in this project as much as in a free Internet accessible by everyone even if have no moneys for a phone bill.

 Then, because of my low bandwidth, I also love the zite local download, so I can access It even if offline (or almost) as well as choose to download optional files all in once! So I can go to bed or take a launch and so enjoy the content =) so.. I can decide to help distributing that content ^_^

another think that I use to do is downloading large zites on the business in the city and so watch these at home :)

- What should I talk about?

mark that by this way we can say something like "__an Internet from the people for the people__."!

It's time for our call! One more time, CONGRATULATIONS for this important goal Tamas!! ; ]
